content.p: Starting an exercise program is an excellent way to improve bone strength and also has beneficial effects on the cardiovascular, immune, and muscular systems. Exercise stresses the bones which causes cells to respond.
Which is true of the cellular response to stress?

question.body: The cells that sense forces on bone are the _________? .

response.feedback: Incorrect. Osteoblasts are important for bone growth and remodeling, but they do not directly sense forces on bone.
Incorrect. Osteoclasts are important for bone remodeling, but they do not directly sense forces on bone.
Correct. Osteocytes sense the amount of stress on the bone in their “area”.
Incorrect.Chondrocytes are important in cartilage, not bone.

part.hint: Hint: These are a fully mature cell type.

question.body: In regions of bone that are experiencing high levels of force, which cells most directly stimulate bone growth?.

response.feedback: Correct. Osteoblasts build bone, which is beneficial in areas of bone experiencing high levels of force (stress).
Incorrect. Osteoclasts break down bone. Although they always have some level of activity, it would be less in areas that are adding bone mass.
Incorrect. Osteocytes are mature bone cells that sense forces, but they do not directly build bone.
Incorrect. Chondroblasts are active in cartilage, not bone.

part.hint: Hint: this cell is not fully differentiated yet, as indicated by its suffix.
